page.title: 06Landscapes & Buildings contd
page.content: It has several large skips into which the public can tip their garden abd household waste not taken away by the dustmen. Pond Farm, Tholthorpe is a grade 2 listed building. It was built in the 1790's and converted into 2 houses in 1970 for use by the same family. Its special features include a long passage on the ground and first floors. The kitchen has the original beams which have the end of the load bearing ones at right angles to the cross beams.(a typical feature if 18th century buildings) The original house had 2 staircases, only 1 remains. The building which now serves as the Village Hall was originally the Village Junoir School. It was leased to the local authority by the village until l963 when the school was closed.
